finding: Pump showing elevated vibration on drive end bearing. Trend increasing over last 3 weeks. Recommend inspection at next opportunity.
Compressor suction pressure trending low. Possible filter fouling. PE impact estimated 2%.
Heat exchanger duty dropping. Fouling suspected on shell side. Delta-T reduced from 28 to 21 degrees.
Intermittent cavitation noise during peak throughput. Likely NPSH margin too tight at current production rate.
Vibration spike observed on anti-surge valve actuation. Valve response sluggish. Instrument check required.
Level control unstable. Controller hunting between 40-60%. Tuning required.
Drive end bearing replaced during planned shutdown. Vibration returned to baseline.
New finding: seal gas flow higher than expected. Possible seal degradation. Monitor closely.
Outlet temperature trending 4 degrees below design. Throughput reduced to compensate. Clean at next outage.
Mechanical seal leaking. Minor. Within acceptable limits but flagged for next maintenance window.
Suction filter replaced. Pressure differential normalised. PE improvement ~2% confirmed post-change.
Foam detected on level instrument. Antifoam dosing increased. Monitor for 48h.
Efficiency curve deviated from baseline by 8%. Impeller wear suspected. Plan inspection.
Shell side cleaned during TAR. Duty restored. Delta-T back to 27 degrees.
Discharge temperature elevated. Interstage cooler underperforming. Tube fouling suspected.
